RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Bacharelado em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal da Paraba (1999), mestrado em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal da Paraba (2001) e doutorado em Software - Universitat Politcnica de Catalunya (2010). Atualmente professor adjunto na Universidade Federal de Campina Grande. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste projeto o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta, denominada NyxCLP, baseada em tcnicas e mtodos formais, para a anlise de conformidade de cdigo para execuo em plantas industriais. A ferramenta possibilitar aos engenheiros determinar automaticamente se o cdigo em execuo em um determinado CLP no viola a especificao da lgica para a qual o cdigo foi desenvolvido, garantindo consistncia entre a documentao aprovada e o cdigo do CLP. Desta forma, diminui-se a possibilidade de falhas na planta devido a alteraes inapropriadas do cdigo do CLP em campo.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper addresses the design and visualization of animated models for coordinated and decentralized discrete event control systems, e.g. manufacturing systems and traffic control systems. We introduce an approach to the design and animation of such controllers based on Coloured Petri nets models and the Design/CPN tool. The approach is illustrated by a simple traffic control network modeling.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper addresses the design and visualization of animated models for coordinated and decentralized discrete event control systems, e.g. manufacturing systems and traffic control systems. We introduce an approach to the design and animation of such controllers based on Coloured Petri nets models and the Design/CPN tool. The approach is illustrated by a simple traffic control network modeling.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we introduce an automatic adaptation approach for Coloured Petri Nets models. For this approach we define a procedure for the synthesis of a new model based on a given model and a set of behavior restrictions. This procedure was defined based on the concepts and techniques of the supervisory control theory and model checking. Moreover, we tackle the adaptation problem in the context of models reuse.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work we introduce an automatic adaptation approach for Coloured Petri Nets models. For this approach we define a procedure for the synthesis of a new model based on a given model and a set of behavior restrictions. This procedure was defined based on the concepts and techniques of the supervisory control theory and model checking. Moreover, we tackle the adaptation problem in the context of models reuse.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the Fifth International Conference Application of Concurrency to System Design

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed processes in digital systems. In previous work, systematic ACM synthesis methods have been proposed. In this paper, we advance this work by developing algorithms and software tools which automate the major part of the ACM synthesis process. Firstly, an interleaving specification is constructed in the form of a state graph, and secondly, a Petri net model of an ``ACM-type'' is derived using the notion of an ACM-region. The method is applied to a number of ``standard'' writing and reading policies of ACMs with shared memory and unidirectional control variables.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed processes in digital systems. In previous work, systematic ACM synthesis methods have been proposed. The method is applied to a number of ``standard'' writing and reading policies of ACMs with shared memory and unidirectional control variables.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho apresenta-se uma metodologia para realizar a sntese automtica de especificaes em redes de Petri que satisfaam a um conjunto de restries de comportamento. Esta metodologia baseia-se dos conceitos da teoria do controle supervisrio e da verificao automtica de modelos para sintetizar um controlador que satisfaa s restries de comportamento.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work presents a methodology for the automatic synthesis of Petri nets specifications satisfying a set of behavioral constraints. This methodology is based on supervisory control theory and model checking conceps to the synthesis of a controller satisfying the constraints.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed concurrent processes. In previous work, an automatic ACM synthesis method based on the generation of the reachability graph and the theory of regions was proposed. In this paper, we propose a new synthesis method based on the composition of Petri net modules, avoiding the exploration of the reachability graph. The behavior of ACMs is formally defined and correctness properties are specified in CTL. Model checking is used to verify the correctness of the Petri net models. The algorithms to generate the Petri net models are presented. Finally, a method to automatically generate C++ source code from the Petri net model is described.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed concurrent processes. The behavior of ACMs is formally defined and correctness properties are specified in CTL. Model checking is used to verify the correctness of the Petri net models. The algorithms to generate the Petri net models are presented. Finally, a method to automatically generate C++ source code from the Petri net model is described.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS) are usually designed to prevent accidents, avoid undesirable situations and guarantee continuous operation of oil and gas production systems. An interruption in the operation can be caused by faults in sensors and/or actuators. Hence, SIS are usually integrated to the supervisor control system in order to use the information from sensors to prevent such undesirable situations. In this scenario, it is important to be able to validate the SIS implementation against its specification in order to increase the reliability of the system. In this work a technique to improve the dependability of SIS is introduced. A method to obtain a timed automata from a ISA 5.2 specification is presented and applied to a case study provided by Petrobras (Brazilian oil company). Finally, an approach to perform automatic testing of the implementation using the generated model is discussed. The method introduced here is based on the use of the Uppaal model checker and the Uppaal-TRON testing tool.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed concurrent processes. In previous work, two automatic ACM synthesis methods have been proposed. However, problems remain unresolved with the most asynchronous type of ACMs, the overwriting and re-reading bounded buffer (OWRRBB), especially with buffer sizes greater than one. In this work, a method of systematic modeling and verification of multi-cell OWRRBBs is presented. This method supports the study of these kinds of ACMs with regard to vital data and temporal characteristics.

This method supports the study of these kinds of ACMs with regard to vital data and temporal characteristics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Pitfalls and Tradeoffs on Dealing with Handoff Management in Bluetooth-based WPANs for Real-Time Applications
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Pitfalls and Tradeoffs on Dealing with Handoff Management in Bluetooth-based WPANs for Real-Time Applications

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 13th IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications (ISCC 2008)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 13th IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, the problems and respective solutions for dealing with two of the most basic questions regarding handoff management are presented: to avoid total loss of connectivity; and to reduce overall time of the handoff procedure. The focus of this research is on handoff in WPANs for real-time applications. Therefore, Bluetooth stands out as the ideal technology for case study due to its particular alignment with the behavior and requirements of the WPAN's network model. Bluetooth's inquiry and paging operations may be calibrated for achieving fast discoveries and connections while scatternets may be used to avoid total loss of connectivity. However, the usage of scatternets and calibration of inquiry and paging unveil a series of challenging aspects when applied along with real-time applications. Such challenges are the priority of inquiry and paging data traffic over users' applications and unpredictability of scatternet behavior. The key point to overwhelm these difficulties is to understand how they affect the real-time data transfers. In this article a set of discussions and experiments that demonstrate how inquiries, pagings and scatternets can aid achieving the goals of fast and uninterrupted handoffs, as well as the tenuous traps and tradeoffs behind such operations and configurations over real-time applications performance are presented.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Sistemas Instrumentados de Segurana so projetados para prevenir acidentes, evitar situaes indesejveis e garantir a operao contnua de sistemas de produo tais como os de petrleo e gs. Neste cenrio importante poder validar a implementao do SIS contra sua especificao para aumentar a confiabilidade do sistema. Neste trabalho introduzida uma tcnica para melhorar a confiabilidade dos SIS. Um mtodo para obter automaticamente um autmato temporizado a partir de Diagramas de Bloco Funcionais (FBD, do ingls Function Block Diagram) apresentado e aplicado a um estudo de caso provido pela Petrobras.

In this scenario, it is important to be able to validate the SIS implementation against its specification in order to increase the reliability of the system. In this work a technique to improve the dependability of SIS is introduced. A method to obtain a timed automata from a Function Block Diagram is presented and applied to a case study provided by Petrobras (Brazilian oil company).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Gerenciamento de Energia em Sistemas Embarcados

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XVII Congresso Brasileiro de Automtica
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XVII Congresso Brasileiro de Automtica, CBA 2008

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nesse trabalho proposta uma tcnica de gerenciamento dinmico de energia orientada autonomia da bateria. Essa tcnica explora um modelo analtico acurado de bateria num ambiente no-estacionrio. O sistema modelado por cadeias de Markov no tempo discreto, em associao ao modelo de bateria. Tal modelo do sistema permite uma formulao matemtica rigorosa do problema e uma soluo de compromisso entre desempenho e autonomia. A tcnica proposta foi implementada usando a plataforma OMAP 1611 da Texas Instruments executando Linux. Atravs dos resultados experimentais verificou-se que a tcnica aqui introduzida resulta em maior autonomia em comparao a tcnicas anteriores.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A battery-aware dynamic power management technique that exploits an accurate analytical battery model in a non-stationary environment is proposed. The system is modelled by discrete-time Markov chains coupled to the battery model. Such model allows a rigorous mathematical formulation of the problem and a trade-off between performance and battery lifetime. The proposed technique has been implemented using the Texas Instruments OMAP 1611 platform running Linux. Experimental results have shown that the technique introduced here results in longer battery lifetime compared to previous techniques.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: International Conference of the Chilean Computer Science Society (SCCC 2008)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed concurrent processes. In this work an automatic method for synthesis of re-reading ACMs is introduced. This method is is oriented to the generation of hardware artifacts. The behavior of re-reading ACMs is formally defined and the correctness properties are discussed. Then it is shown how to generate the ACMs specifications and how they can be translated into a proper hardware implementation. Verilog has been used as the target language to describe the hardware being synthesized.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 16th International Conference on Software, Telecommunications and Computer Networks
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceddings of the 16th International Conference on Software, Telecommunications and Computer Networks (SoftCOM 2008)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Wireless Personal Area Networks (WPANs) have been widely used due to the development of new wireless technologies, mainly Bluetooth. As user mobility is the focus of WPANs some questions arise when developing applications for it, specifically handoff management. Despite Bluetooth having been used for WPAN applications it does not have facilities for handoff management. It provides inquiry and paging operations that have priority over application data in the interface. This property has an impact for real-time applications. In this work a Bluetooth handoff management is modelled and analysed using Coloured Petri Nets. All the signalling and message exchanging are done by access points and never by the mobile devices during handoff. Moreover, the protocol uses only standard Bluetooth operations.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS) are designed to prevent accidents, avoid undesirable situations and guarantee continuous operation of oil and gas production systems. An interruption in the operation can be caused by faults in sensors and/or actuators. Hence, SIS are integrated to the supervisory control system in order to use the information from sensors to prevent such undesirable situations. In this scenario, it is important to be able to validate the SIS implementation against its specification in order to increase the reliability of thesystem. In this work a technique to obtain a timed automata from Function Block Diagram (FBD) implementation of a SIS is presented and applied to a case study provided by Petrobras (Brazilian oil company). This is a step towards automatic conformance testing between specification in ISA 5.2 and the implementation in FBD for a SIS to improve its dependability.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: With the increasing complexity of control systems in industries, the use of standards become essential to ensure a better project quality. The focus of this work is to show the application, the importance and the benefits of the use of standards for an widely used equipment in industry called Programmable Logic Controller (PLC). Standards relating to specification, ISA 5.2 diagrams, and the implementation, IEC 61131-3 of programs for PLCs are used. Based on these standards an approach to automatic extraction of timed automata for model-based testing of industrial control systems has been developed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo deste trabalho apresentar um mtodo que aumente a confiana e a segurana na automao de processos controlados por Controladores Lgicos Programveis (CLPs). Para tanto, gerao e execuo automtica de casos de teste de conformidade so utilizadas para verificar se o programa do CLP est em conformidade com a especificao. O mtodo consiste em gerar automaticamente modelos de autmatos temporizados, segundo a sintaxe e semntica da ferramenta Uppaal, a partir de Diagramas de Lgica Binria ISA 5.2 (especificao) e programas escritos na linguagem Ladder (implementao). Aps a gerao destes modelos, testes de conformidade so realizados usando a ferramenta de teste Uppaal-TRON. Um estudo de caso da empresa Petrobras ilustrado neste trabalho.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The goal of this work is to present a method to ensure the safety and dependability in the automation of processes controlled by Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs). Therefore, automatic generation and execution of conformance testing cases are used to verify the conformance between the PLC program and the specification. The method uses the Uppaal tool syntax and semantic to automatically generate timed automata models from ISA 5.2 Binary Logic Diagrams (specification) and Ladder language (implementation). After the models generation, conformance testing is performed using the Uppaal-TRON tool. A case study of Petrobras company is illustrated in this work.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O crescente nvel de complexidade dos sistemas atuais de hardware e software exige, cadas vez mais, dos desenvolvedores e ferramentas. H sistemas complexos onde falhas so inaceitveis, a fim de evit-las vrias tcnicas e ferramentas de teste de software esto surgindo. O objetivo deste artigo introduzir e demonstrar a ferramenta Gungnir a qual possibilita ao desenvolvedor testar e simular sistemas utilizando modelagem formal baseada em autmatos temporizados. Sistemas de automaao e controle so bons exemplos para aplicao do Gungnir, pois normalmente so crticos e possuem restrio temporal.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The increasing complexity level of current hardware and software systems demands more from developers and tools. In some critial control systems failures are not acceptable. Therefore, in order to avoid them several techniques and tools for software testing are emerging. This paper aims to introduce and demonstrate the Gungnir tool which allows developers to test and simulate systems using a formal model based on timed automata. Automation and control systems are good examples of Gungnir application because usually they are critical and have time restriction.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Control systems are used to produce a certain result with little or no human supervision. The principal aim of such systems is to ensure that resources are used efficiently and that the desired product quality is achieved. Moreover, for critical systems such as oil and gas plants, it is important to guarantee the safety and reliability of the operation. Therefore, it is necessary to verify whether what is running in the device is in accordance with what was defined in the specification documents. The goal of this work is to present a method that automatically generates the timed automata models from the specification ISA 5.2 Binary Logic Diagrams, and the implementation Ladder programs, for model-based analysis, in order to increase the dependability in the behavior of critical control systems. This approach is based on the use of the Uppaal tool and the Uppaal-TRON testing tool.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Sistemas de Controle so sistemas utilizados para produzir um certo resultado com pouca ou nenhuma superviso humana. O principal objetivo destes sistemas assegurar que os recursos sero utilizados de forma eficiente e que a qualidade desejada do produto seja alcanada. Alm disto, para sistemas crticos como plantas de produo de petrleo e gs importante garantir a segurana e a confiana na operao. Portanto, necessrio verificar, atravs do uso de tcnicas de verificao, se o que est executando no dispositivo est em conformidade com o que foi definido nos documentos de especificao. O objetivo deste trabalho apresentar um mtodo que gere automaticamente autmatos temporizados a partir de programas Ladder para realizar anlise baseada em modelos com o intuito de aumentar a segurana e a confiana no funcionamento de sistemas crticos de controle.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Control systems are used to produce a certain result with minimal or none human supervision. The principal aim of such systems is to ensure that resources are used efficiently and that the desired product quality be achieved. Moreover, for critical systems such as oil and gas plants, it is important to guarantee the safety and reliability of the operation. Therefore, it is necessary to verify, through use of techniques for verification, whether what is running in the device is in accordance with what was defined in the specification documents. The goal of this work is to present a method that automatically generates the timed automata model from Ladder programs for model-based analysis, in order to increase the confidence in the behavior of critical control systems.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: UPnP defines an architecture for pervasive peer-to-peer network connectivity of intelligent appliances, wireless devices, and PCs of all form factors and platforms. It is designed to support zero-configuration, "invisible" networking, and automatic discovery for a breadth of device categories from a wide range of vendors. UPnP-UP is an extension of the UPnP protocol that provides support to customized services in UPnP networks. This paper presents the modeling of the UPnP-UP protocol using Coloured Petri Nets (CPN). CPN have a graphical representation and a well-defined semantics allowing formal analysis and verification of systems.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Low-Rate Wireless Personal Area Networks is a new standard for wireless networks developed by the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers to transmit information on short distances at low rates. This work presents a formal model of Carrier Sense Multiple Access - Collision Avoidance machanism. The formal model of build using Hierarchical Coloured Petri Nets. CPN tools is used as modeling environment. It allows the simulation, verification and validation of the models.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste trabalho apresentamos uma tcnica para a traduo de programas Ladder para modelos de Redes de Petri Coloridas (CPN). Ladder usada no desenvolvimento de software para Controladores Lgico Programveis, dispositivos usados na automao industrial (e.g.; plantas qumicas, de gs e de petrleo). Neste contexto so necessrios alto nvel de confiana e de segurana, pois a ocorrncia de faltas pode resultar em grandes perdas financeiras e at mesmo de vidas humanas. Assim, aspectos formais inerentes s CPN e seu suporte ferramental podem ser usados para garantir o nvel de confiana desejado de tais sistemas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work we present a technique for translating Ladder to Coloured Petri Nets (CPN) models. Ladder is used in software developing for Programmable Logic Controllers, devices used in industrial automation (e.g.; gas, oil and chemical plants). In this context, a high level of reliability and safety are necessary because faults can cause from lost of big amounts of money to danger to human lives. Thus, formal aspects of CPN and its tool support can be used to assure a certain level of reliability for such systems.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IEEE 9th International Conference on Industrial Informatics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) have been used in industrial environment to control several different tasks. Such devices can be programmed using one of the languages specified in the IEC 61131-3 standard, such as Ladder or Functional Logic Diagrams. PLCs are widely used in a number of critical environment, such as in the extraction processes of oil and gas. For this reason, systems running on PLCs requires a high level of reliability. In general, it is necessary to perform formal verification to achieve such a level of reliability. Formal behavioral models of the system are built to simulate and verify desired properties. Among many available formalisms, Petri Nets (PN) have been used successfully although the task of modeling demands extra time in the development process. Aiming to amortize time invested in formal verification, this paper presents a method to automatically obtain formal models, described with a class of PN called Coloured Petri Nets, directly from Ladder diagrams. With these models in hand, it is not only possible to simulate the system but it is also possible to apply automatic verification techniques.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a nutshell, UPnP aims to enable simple and robust connectivity among consumer electronics, intelligent appliances and mobile devices from many different vendors. Nowadays, it is getting an increasing popularity due to its robust way of connecting devices and the massive number of already developed applications, complementing the useful new era of pervasive computing. Although UPnP is an easy-to-use solution for discovery, which allows controlled devices to share and access users contents, it does neither provide user authentication nor authorization mechanisms, requirements that would require user?s data on personal profiles. As a consequence, we propose an extension of the UPnP protocol called UPnP-UP, which allows user authentication and authorization for UPnP devices and applications. The primary goal of our proposed extension is to modify the current UPnP specification as less as possible, maintaining backwards compatibility with previous versions of the protocol. Furthermore, we present our efforts on the development of a UPnP framework for publishing and accessing multimedia contents in order to support this extension as a case of study.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In a nutshell, UPnP aims to enable simple and robust connectivity among consumer electronics, intelligent appliances and mobile devices from many different vendors. Nowadays, it is getting an increasing popularity due to its robust way of connecting devices and the massive number of already developed applications, complementing the useful new era of pervasive computing. Although UPnP is an easy-to-use solution for discovery, which allows controlled devices to share and access users contents, it does neither provide user authentication nor authorization mechanisms, requirements that would require user?s data on personal profiles. As a consequence, we propose an extension of the UPnP protocol called UPnP-UP, which allows user authentication and authorization for UPnP devices and applications. The primary goal of our proposed extension is to modify the current UPnP specification as less as possible, maintaining backwards compatibility with previous versions of the protocol. Furthermore, we present our efforts on the development of a UPnP framework for publishing and accessing multimedia contents in order to support this extension as a case of study.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Automating Synthesis of Asynchronous Communication Mechanisms

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed processes in digital systems. In previous work, systematic ACM synthesis methods have been proposed. In this paper, we advance this work by developing algorithms and software tools which automate most of the ACM synthesis process. Firstly, an interleaving specification is constructed in the form of a state graph, and secondly, a Petri net model of an "ACM-type" is derived using the theory of regions. The method is applied to a number of "standard" writing and reading policies of ACMs with shared memory and unidirectional control variables.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Software Engineering for Secure Systems: Industrial and Research Perspectives

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Control Systems are used to produce a certain result with little or no human supervision. The principal aim of such systems is to ensure that resources are used efficiently and that the desired product quality is achieved. Moreover for critical systems such as oil and gas plants, it is important to guarantee the safety and dependability of the operation. Therefore, it is necessary to verify whether what is running in the device is in accordance with what was defined in the specification documents. The goal of this chapter is to present a method that automatically generates the timed automata models from the specification ISA 5.2 Binary Logic Diagrams, and the implementation Ladder programs, for model-based analysis, in order to increase the confidence in the behavior of critical Control Systems. This approach is based on the use of the Uppaal tool and the Uppaal-TRON testing tool.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Control Systems are used to produce a certain result with little or no human supervision. The principal aim of such systems is to ensure that resources are used efficiently and that the desired product quality is achieved. Moreover for critical systems such as oil and gas plants, it is important to guarantee the safety and dependability of the operation. Therefore, it is necessary to verify whether what is running in the device is in accordance with what was defined in the specification documents. The goal of this chapter is to present a method that automatically generates the timed automata models from the specification ISA 5.2 Binary Logic Diagrams, and the implementation Ladder programs, for model-based analysis, in order to increase the confidence in the behavior of critical Control Systems. This approach is based on the use of the Uppaal tool and the Uppaal-TRON testing tool.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Petri Nets for Component-based Software Systems Development

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Modeling and Verifying Asynchronous Communication Mechanisms using Coloured Petri Nets

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Asynchronous data communication mechanisms (ACMs) have been extensively studied as data connectors between independently timed concurrent processes. In previous work, two automatic ACM synthesis methods have been proposed. However, problems remain unresolved with the most asynchronous type of ACMs, the overwriting and re-reading bounded buffer (OWRRBB), especially with buffer sizes greater than one. In this work, a method of systematic modeling and verification of multi-cell OWRRBBs is presented. This method supports the study of these kinds of ACMs with regard to vital data and temporal characteristics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE: Simulador para Sistema de Controle de Trfego

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Simulador de controle de trfego usando Redes de Petri Coloridas.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este animador interage com a ferramenta de modelagem Design/CPN (que permite a modelagem e anlise de sistemas de software descritos em redes de Petri coloridas) para gerar uma sada grfica que permite visualizar a funcionamento do sistema real. O sistema foi desenvolvido utilizando as tecnologias Java e testado sobre o ambiente operacional GNU/Linux.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE: Adaptador de Modelos em Redes de Petri Coloridas

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Adaptar automtica modelos descritos em redes de Petri coloridas.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O adaptador automtico de modelos para redes de Petri coloridas realiza a sntese de modelos a partir de um modelo fornecido inicialmente e de um conjunto de restries de comportamento a serem aplicados sobre modelo fornecido. Este procedimento foi definido utilizando os conceitos e tcnicas da teoria do controle supervisrio e da verificao automtica de modelos. Alm disso, atacou-se o problema da adaptao dentro do contexto de reso de modelos. Este trabalho foi desenvolvido utilizando a ferramenta de modelagem para redes de Petri coloridas denominado Design/CPN e todo o cdigo fonte gerado est escrito em ML.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Gerador automtico de espao de estados para ACMs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Jabuti um sistema que realiza a sntese automtica de Mecanismos de Comunicao Assncronos (ACM - Asynchronous Communication Mechanisms). Mais precisamente, Jabuti um programa que recebe como entrada uma especificao funcional de um ACM e automaticamente gera um autmato finito determinstico que satisfaz ao conjunto de propriedades especficadas pela poltica dada pela especificao funcional.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Gerenciamento de energia em ambientes corporativos

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenao de Aperfeioamento de Pessoal de Nvel Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Diante do crescimento do contexto de redes corporativas e da necessidade de mtodos de gerenciamento de energia sofisticados para as mesmas, o presente trabalho investiga a viabilidade de uma poltica dinmica de gerenciamento de energia que reflita em um menor consumo das redes corporativas. Por meio do gerenciamento dos componentes de hardware de cada mquina e das informaes do consumo enviadas ao servidor, busca-se agrupar as mquinas que possuam uma carga de trabalho similar definindo para as mesma uma poltica que reflita em uma maior eficincia energtica, que atrelada a um agendamento dos seus usos produza ganhos na economia de energia, da rede corporativa, quando comparadas a outras tcnicas do atual estado da arte.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Gerenciamento de energia em ambientes corporativos

PARTICIPANTE-BANCA.NOME-PARA-CITACAO-DO-PARTICIPANTE-DA-BAN: GORGONIO, KYLLER;GORGNIO, K. C.;GORGNIO, K.;GORGONIO, KYLLER COSTA;GORGNIO, KYLLER COSTA;GORGNIO, KYLLER C.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Diante do crescimento do contexto de redes corporativas e da necessidade de mtodos de gerenciamento de energia sofisticados para as mesmas, o presente trabalho investiga a viabilidade de uma poltica dinmica de gerenciamento de energia que reflita em um menor consumo das redes corporativas. Por meio do gerenciamento dos componentes de hardware de cada mquina e das informaes do consumo enviadas ao servidor, busca-se agrupar as mquinas que possuam uma carga de trabalho similar definindo para as mesma uma poltica que reflita em uma maior eficincia energtica, que atrelada a um agendamento dos seus usos produza ganhos na economia de energia, da rede corporativa, quando comparadas a outras tcnicas do atual estado da arte.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Uma arquitetura baseada na combinao de dispositivos vestveis para aumentar a acurcia no reconhecimento de atividades

DETALHAMENTO-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-DE.NOME-DO-CANDIDATO: Anne Lorayne Gernimo Silva Augusto Moreira

PARTICIPANTE-BANCA.NOME-PARA-CITACAO-DO-PARTICIPANTE-DA-BAN: GORGONIO, KYLLER;GORGNIO, K. C.;GORGNIO, K.;GORGONIO, KYLLER COSTA;GORGNIO, KYLLER COSTA;GORGNIO, KYLLER C.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O reconhecimento de atividades refere-se ao ato de detectar comportamentos humanos de forma automtica. Em pesquisas recentes sobre reconhecimento de atividades foi demonstrado que possvel reconhecer uma variedade de atividades como: andar, correr, permanecer sentado e permanecer parado, com acurcia acima de 90%. Esse reconhecimento preciso proporciona o desenvolvimento de muitas aplicaes na rea de computao pervasiva. Por exemplo, personalizar aes do smartphone para selecionar uma msica para ouvir baseada em uma atividade ou enviar chamadas diretamente para o correio de voz quando o usurio estiver se exercitando. Contudo, algumas atividades humanas complexas como: assistir TV, comer, alongar, subir escada, utilizar o elevador, lavar as mos, mostraram-se mais difceis de serem reconhecidas com uma boa acurcia. O presente trabalho visa identiﬁcar as melhores formas de utilizar os dispositivos vestveis para identiﬁcar determinadas atividades e deﬁnir quais dados provenientes dos dispositivos vestveis so relevantes para o reconhecimento de atividades humanas complexas. O trabalho tem como objetivo principal o desenvolvimento de uma arquitetura de reconhecimento de atividades baseada na combinao de dispositivos vestveis para aumentar a acurcia do reconhecimento de atividades complexas.
